wp:term.wp:term_description: Amazon is a multinational technology company founded by Jeff Bezos in 1994, originally as an online bookstore. It has since grown into the world’s largest e-commerce platform, offering millions of products across categories like electronics, clothing, and groceries. Amazon also operates in cloud computing (AWS), streaming (Prime Video), AI (Alexa), and logistics, making it a global leader in retail and technology innovation.

Bahama Breeze is a U.S.-based restaurant chain known for its Caribbean-inspired menu and tropical atmosphere. It serves seafood, grilled meats, and island-themed cocktails, aiming to give guests a relaxed, vacation-like dining experience.

Our beauty products are designed to enhance your natural glow, keep your skin nourished, and boost your confidence. With gentle, high-quality ingredients, they help hydrate, protect, and rejuvenate—so you can look and feel your best every day.

CafePress is an online retailer that specializes in custom-printed products, allowing customers to create and sell personalized items like T-shirts, mugs, bags, and home décor. It serves as a marketplace for both individual designers and shoppers looking for unique, made-to-order merchandise.
Clothing provides comfort, protection, and self-expression, helping you stay confident, adapt to different environments, and showcase your personal style.

Cracker Barrel is an American restaurant and retail chain known for its Southern-style comfort food and old-country store concept. It offers hearty meals like biscuits, fried chicken, and country ham, alongside a gift shop selling nostalgic candies, toys, and home décor.

DoorDash is a U.S.-based food delivery platform that connects customers with local restaurants, grocery stores, and other merchants. Through its app and website, users can order meals and products for delivery or pickup, with independent drivers (Dashers) handling the deliveries.
Education empowers people with knowledge, skills, and confidence, helping them make informed decisions, improve their quality of life, and contribute positively to society
Electronics make life easier and more efficient, helping people connect, work, learn, and enjoy entertainment through innovative technology and smart solutions.
Fashion allows self-expression, boosts confidence, and helps people feel comfortable and empowered in their own style.
Fitness improves strength, energy, and overall health, boosting mood and confidence while helping the body stay active and resilient.
Food provides essential nutrients and energy, supporting growth, health, and overall well-being while bringing joy and connection through shared meals
Furniture provides comfort, functionality, and organization, creating spaces that support daily living while reflecting personal style and enhancing the home’s atmosphere.
Good health supports a vibrant, active life by boosting energy, preventing illness, and enhancing overall well-being and happiness.
Jewelry enhances personal style, symbolizes meaningful moments, and boosts confidence, making it both a form of self-expression and a cherished keepsake.

Loft Outlet is a retail chain offering discounted women’s apparel and accessories from the LOFT brand. It features stylish, casual, and work-ready clothing at lower prices, catering to shoppers looking for fashionable deals

Romano’s Macaroni Grill is a U.S.-based casual dining restaurant chain specializing in Italian-American cuisine. It offers pasta, pizza, seafood, and grilled dishes in a warm, rustic setting inspired by traditional Italian kitchens.

McDonald’s is a global fast-food chain known for its burgers, fries, and breakfast items. Founded in 1940, it has grown into one of the world’s largest restaurant brands, serving millions daily across over 100 countries.

Michaels is a leading U.S. arts and crafts retail chain offering supplies for hobbies, DIY projects, home décor, framing, and seasonal decorations. It caters to creative enthusiasts, from beginners to professional crafters.

Nike is a global sportswear and athletic brand known for its footwear, apparel, and equipment. Founded in 1964, it is recognized for innovative designs, performance technology, and its iconic “Swoosh” logo.

Paris City Vision is a tour company offering guided sightseeing tours, excursions, and activities in Paris and surrounding areas. It provides visitors with convenient ways to explore iconic landmarks like the Eiffel Tower, Louvre, and Versailles.

Red Roof is an American economy hotel chain known for affordable, comfortable lodging with convenient locations across the U.S. It offers essential amenities for budget-conscious travelers and pet-friendly options.
Restaurants offer delicious meals, a convenient dining experience, and a welcoming space to relax, socialize, and enjoy diverse flavors without the hassle of cooking.
Sports promote physical health, teamwork, and discipline while enhancing mental well-being and fostering social connections.

Squarespace is a website building platform that allows users to create professional-looking websites, online stores, and blogs easily without coding. It offers customizable templates, hosting, and integrated tools for design, marketing, and analytics.
Travel broadens perspectives, enriches experiences, and refreshes the mind, offering opportunities to explore new places, cultures, and connections.

Woot is an online marketplace known for offering daily deals and limited-time discounts on a wide range of products, including electronics, home goods, and apparel. It features a fun, bargain-focused shopping experience.
WWE Shop is the official online store for World Wrestling Entertainment, offering licensed merchandise such as apparel, accessories, collectibles, and memorabilia featuring WWE superstars and brands.

item.title: contact_form
item.dc:creator: dealsoffer
item.content:encoded:
<label for="mf-input-text-229b8a8">
					${ parent.decodeEntities(`First Name`) } 					*
				</label>
			<input
				type="text"
				class="mf-input mf-conditional-input"
				id="mf-input-text-229b8a8"
				name="mf-first-name"
				placeholder="${ parent.decodeEntities(`First name here`) } "
									onInput=${parent.handleChange}
					onBlur=${parent.handleChange}
					aria-invalid=${validation.errors['mf-first-name'] ? 'true' : 'false'}
					ref=${el =>{
												parent.activateValidation({"message":"This field is required.","minLength":1,"maxLength":"","type":"none","required":true,"expression":"null"}, el)
					}}
								/>
							<${validation.ErrorMessage}
					errors=${validation.errors}
					name="mf-first-name"
					as=${html``}
					/>
							<label for="mf-input-text-1a922000">
					${ parent.decodeEntities(`Last Name`) } 					*
				</label>
			<input
				type="text"
				class="mf-input mf-conditional-input"
				id="mf-input-text-1a922000"
				name="mf-last-name"
				placeholder="${ parent.decodeEntities(`Last name here`) } "
									onInput=${parent.handleChange}
					onBlur=${parent.handleChange}
					aria-invalid=${validation.errors['mf-last-name'] ? 'true' : 'false'}
					ref=${el =>{
												parent.activateValidation({"message":"This field is required.","minLength":1,"maxLength":"","type":"none","required":true,"expression":"null"}, el)
					}}
								/>
							<${validation.ErrorMessage}
					errors=${validation.errors}
					name="mf-last-name"
					as=${html``}
					/>
							<label for="mf-input-email-752b6f44">
					${ parent.decodeEntities(`Email Address`) } 					*
				</label>
			<input 
				type="email" 
				defaultValue="" 
				class="mf-input mf-conditional-input" 
				id="mf-input-email-752b6f44" 
				name="mf-email" 
				placeholder="${ parent.decodeEntities(`Add email`) } " 
				onBlur=${parent.handleChange} onFocus=${parent.handleChange} aria-invalid=${validation.errors['mf-email'] ? 'true' : 'false' } 
				ref=${el=> parent.activateValidation({"message":"This field is required.","emailMessage":"Please enter a valid Email address","minLength":1,"maxLength":"","type":"none","required":true,"expression":"null"}, el)}
							/>
						<${validation.ErrorMessage} 
				errors=${validation.errors} 
				name="mf-email" 
				as=${html``}
			/>
							<label for="mf-input-text-452c321f">
					${ parent.decodeEntities(`Subject`) } 					*
				</label>
			<input
				type="text"
				class="mf-input mf-conditional-input"
				id="mf-input-text-452c321f"
				name="mf-subject"
				placeholder="${ parent.decodeEntities(`How can we help you?`) } "
									onInput=${parent.handleChange}
					onBlur=${parent.handleChange}
					aria-invalid=${validation.errors['mf-subject'] ? 'true' : 'false'}
					ref=${el =>{
												parent.activateValidation({"message":"This field is required.","minLength":1,"maxLength":"","type":"none","required":true,"expression":"null"}, el)
					}}
								/>
							<${validation.ErrorMessage}
					errors=${validation.errors}
					name="mf-subject"
					as=${html``}
					/>
							<label for="mf-input-text-area-13f46608">
					${ parent.decodeEntities(`Comments / Questions`) } 					*
				</label>
			<textarea id="mf-input-text-area-13f46608"
				name="mf-comment" 
				placeholder="${ parent.decodeEntities(`Comments`) } "
				cols="30" rows="10"
									onInput=${ parent.handleChange }
					aria-invalid=${validation.errors['mf-comment'] ? 'true' : 'false'}
					ref=${ el => parent.activateValidation({"message":"This field is required.","minLength":1,"maxLength":"","type":"none","required":true,"expression":"null"}, el)}
								></textarea>
							<${validation.ErrorMessage}
					errors=${validation.errors}
					name="mf-comment"
					as=${html``}
					/>
							<button type="submit" id="">
					${ parent.decodeEntities(`Send Message`) } 
				</button>

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: dealsoffer
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)

...or something like this:

The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.

As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: dealsoffer
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Suggested text: Our website address is: https://dealsoffer.themephi.net.

Comments

Suggested text: When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

Suggested text: If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Cookies

Suggested text: If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Suggested text: Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Who we share your data with

Suggested text: If you request a password reset, your IP address will be included in the reset email.

How long we retain your data

Suggested text: If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

Suggested text: If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where your data is sent

Suggested text: Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

More than 3000 Stores in One Place

Affiliate success starts with coupons, discounts, and savings

Share trending coupons and hot deals, earn affiliate income, and grow your audience with high-converting discount promotions easily.

How DealsOffer Works

Simple Steps to Unlock Discounts

01

Log In & Shop

Click your favourite coupon & Shop

Cashback gets added to your DealsOffer wallet

Cashback Earned

02

03

Withdraw Cashback

To your bank account, or as a voucher, recharge

How DealsOffer Works

Best Offers Right Now

Live in Style for Less – 30% Off Furniture

GET CODE  YTYTYRO x 02 Apr, 2027 589 1 0

Half Price Knowledge – Education Sale is On

Tech for Less – 50% Off Electronics Today!

GET CODE  YUGHJNN x 02 Apr, 2027 732 1 0

Half Price, Full Power – Sports Sale is On

GET CODE  UGHJNMB x 02 Apr, 2027 956 1 0

Fit for Less – 50% Off All Fitness Gear!

GET CODE  UGHJVBN x

Save More with Wallet Cash

Click here

Bank Offers

Wallet Offers

Global Shopping Platforms

Your Favorite Stores, All in One Place

30-day money-back guarantee

If you are not 100% satisfied, you can request a refund of your payment within a period of 30 days after your purchase. The process is seamless and risk-free. For more information, please check our refund policy (exclusions may apply).

Get Started
